title: Display the dashboard directly on the homepage (publicly visible)

requirements.text: Render the existing dashboard content directly on the homepage and make it visible to all users without requiring Internet Identity authentication, while keeping the existing protected /dashboard route unchanged.

quotes: can't find the admin dashboard, place it in an obvious place
1. homepage 2. visible to all users 3. dashboard

acceptanceCriteria: Visiting the root route ("/") shows a clearly labeled section titled "dashboard" on the homepage.
The dashboard section renders the same submissions dashboard UI currently shown under the protected dashboard area (the content from the submissions view: heading, stats, filters, and table).
The dashboard section renders without triggering the admin access gate (it must not show the AccessDeniedScreen for non-admin/non-authenticated users when viewed on the homepage).
The existing /dashboard route continues to require admin access as it does today (no change to AdminDashboardLayout access control).

requirements.text: Add an in-page navigation affordance so the dashboard is easy to find from the top of the homepage (e.g., a "dashboard" link that scrolls to the dashboard section).

quotes: place it in an obvious place

acceptanceCriteria: From the top of the homepage, there is a visible navigation element labeled "dashboard".
Activating the "dashboard" navigation element scrolls/jumps to the dashboard section on the homepage.
User-facing text for the label is exactly "dashboard" (lowercase), as requested.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only).
Do not edit frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts or frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts (immutable paths).
Backend must remain single-actor (no new backend services/canisters).
nonGoals: Do not change backend schema or add new backend endpoints for this change.
Do not remove or weaken admin authentication/authorization for the existing /dashboard admin area.
Do not redesign unrelated homepage sections (Hero/Services/Contact/Form) beyond what is necessary to place the dashboard section.
